translated: who has freed me from suffering,
craving, the cause, is dried up;
not knowing as it really is,

original: saṁsariṁhaṁ anibbisaṁ.🔽Diṭṭho hi me so bhagavā,
analyzed: sasariham anibbisa  diṭṭhaḥ hi me saḥ bhagavā
translated: I wandered on, not liberated.🔽But now that I have seen the Blessed One,
The round of births is exhausted,

analyzed: na atthi dāni punabbhavaḥ  āraddha vīriye pahitatte
translated: there is no continuation of existence.🔽Seeing the disciples of the Buddha
in harmony, this is worship of the Buddhas.
For those afflicted with sickness and death,
he removed the mass of suffering.”🔽… the elder nun Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī …
